summary: The Restoring Vehicle Market Freedom Act of 2025 proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to eliminate several key tax credits aimed at promoting alternative fuel and clean energy vehicles. The bill would repeal credits for previously owned clean vehicles (Section 25E), new qualified plug-in electric vehicles (Section 30D), alternative motor vehicles (Section 30B), alternative fuel vehicle refueling property (Section 30C), and qualified commercial clean vehicles (Section 45W). The repeals would take effect for vehicles and property acquired or placed in service after the bill's enactment date.
